title: How do I turn off threads to ALL messages permenantly in Thunderbird?
content:
I want to turn off ALL threads in Thunderbird.

Just the last two days TWO IMPORTANT messages (from two different people) on my computer did not display in my email feed, I only saw them by accident on my phone..

I have searched very, very many times to change the settings, but regardless of what I do, it doesn't help..

I have tried "View / Sort by / Unthreaded", it doesn't work.. I have tried to look for the "Organize Mail by Thread" in Settings, I cannot find it. I have spent SOOOO much time trying to find out about this, but not been successful... (It is NOT the first time this has happened!)

Can anyone help??

title: Firefox 115.0 Freezes Unpredictably Ubuntu 23.04
content:
When browning some site will cause a Firefox to freeze, all UI stops working, if I try and reload the page nothing will load and if I try and close and reopen Firefox I get a zombie process that last for about a minute. Obviously this is with no ad dons or hardware acceleration and nothing is listed at about:crashes. The only useful tip I have comes from the command prompt. First when the freeze is first triggered I get the errors ``` MESA: error: Failed to query drm device. libEGL warning: egl: failed to create dri2 screen MESA: error: Failed to query drm device. libEGL warning: egl: failed to create dri2 screen ``` and when I try and open it after a freeze and there is still a zombie Processes ``` [Parent 111218, IPC I/O Parent] WARNING: process 111455 exited on signal 15: file /build/firefox-RH6krf/firefox-115.0+build2/ipc/chromium/src/base/process_util_posix.cc:264

``` and finally when it kills the zombie processes ``` RunWatchdog: Mainthread nested event loops during hang: 

--- CanvasManagerParent::Shutdown

ExceptionHandler::GenerateDump cloned child 111871 ExceptionHandler::SendContinueSignalToChild sent continue signal to child ExceptionHandler::WaitForContinueSignal waiting for continue signal... ``` the included images are what pops up when trying to open Firefox when it still has a zombie processes and when it kills the process
creator: Charles_Clarke_mk2

title: Firefox and the Irish Revenue Service
content:
I'm a Firefox user for many years. The Irish Government Revenue service provide a facility where forms can be completed offline and then uploaded. Recently they brought out a new version which can aparently be used only on Edge or Chrome whereas previously Firefox was always supported. They say it because Firefox does not support this API:

The API being used is: https://developer.chrome.com/articles/file-system-access/

I'm sort of mad over this as I believe governments should be bending over backwords to support organisations like Mozilla. I'd really appreciate any info you could give me so that I could pursue the matter further.

Peter Pierse FCA Tralee Ireland

title: Webinterface not loading - possible security risk
content:
Hi,

we have some appliances with a webadmin interface over https with a custom port. Since one of the last Updates, Firefox 102.3 (portable) is still working, I can not load the webadmin of said appliances when I try to connect over DNS or the WAN IP, it's only allowed to be accessed through our WAN IP or from the local network. When I connect with the internal IP address of the Appliance or if I use Opera/Edge (both I don't want to use) I get the option to accept the Security Risk and Continue. It's not with every Appliance, same vendor, same firmware but maybe newer certificate. But all certificates still valid, but self-signed.

What can we do, other than not use Firefox?

Greetings from Germany, Andreas

title: RAM and CPU usage going crazy - but I can't see why
content:
Hi,

I'm on an 8 core, i7 Intel system - 3.6ghz - with 32gb RAM. For some reason, Firefox is being weird. I'm not sure when it got this bad, but its been a bit odd for a while (hearing the computer fan coming on more, and looking at task manager it shows FF as the culprit running at high RAM and CPU)

See an example attached. It has almost 10gb of the RAM going to it, with over 6gb on one process (I think it even got up to 7.5gb at one point, before going back down).

So what could be causing it? I've got a few extensions:

Dashlane No-Cache: No store for selected hosts Web Developer

I have 6 pinned tabs - nothing fancy, just my Amazon seller page, couple of webmail portals (Roundcube) and a few others. Then currently a couple of extra non-pinned tabs

As I'm writing this, the whole browser keeps locking up as I type - and then catches up. Something is not right :/

Any suggestions on where to look? I'm not too keep on starting a "new profile", as it'll lose all my history that I use on a daily basis for my work :(

Thanks

Andy

title: Firefox 115: menu and tabs background color changed
content:
After Firefox upgraded from 114.02 to 115 menu and tabs background color changed:

FF 114: https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2023-07-05-17-00-30-1a3adf.png FF 115: https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2023-07-05-17-00-34-cba7e0.png

These are screenshots of active window. When window of v115 becomes inactive, background color changes to lighter, but still no visible horizontal line between menu and tabs. I don't use any additional themes, "System theme — auto" is selected.

From release notes for FF 115: For users with a Firefox Colorways built-in theme, the theme will be automatically migrated to the same theme hosted on addons.mozilla.org for Firefox profiles that have disabled add-ons auto-updates. This will allow users to keep their Colorways theme when they are later removed from Firefox installer files. I guess it is relevant somehow, but i never installed Colorways and don't know what is it.

How to make FF 115 look like it was in 114? I can see changes in `browser/themes/` in sources between 114.02 and 115. Is it possible to "extract" default theme from 114 and install/apply it to 115?

I use Firefox under Fluxbox window manager in Arch Linux, if it matters.
creator: dimich.dmb
